text: The Fred W. Smith National Library for the Study of George Washington at Mount Vernon is the presidential library of George Washington, the first president of the United States. It is located in Fairfax, Virginia. It was dedicated in September 2013. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official site Washington Category:George Washington Category:Buildings and structures in Virginia Category:2013 establishments in the United States Category:21st-century establishments in Virginia Category:Fairfax, Virginia
title: Fred W. Smith National Library for the Study of George Washington
